title: Non-Fiction Text Features and Organization

vocab.definition: Writing that gives facts and information about real things
Parts of a text like headings, captions, and charts that help organize information
A title that tells what a section of text is about
Text that explains what is shown in a picture or diagram
A list at the beginning of a book showing what topics are covered

teachingNotes: Use real examples of textbooks and non-fiction books. Practice using text features to find information quickly. Emphasize how these features help readers understand organization.

sample.question: What type of writing gives facts about real things?

truefalse.question: A caption explains what is shown in a picture.

multiplechoice.question: What text feature would you use to quickly find a specific chapter?

fillintheblank.question: A title that tells what a section is about is called a ________.

shortanswer.question: Name three text features that help organize information in non-fiction books.
